north.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: the direction that is at the top of a map of the world, above the Equator. It is on the left if you are facing the rising sun
north.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Cheshunt is a few miles to the north of London.
north.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: in the north or facing the north
north.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The north side of the building doesn’t get much sun.
north.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a north wind comes from the north
north.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: The birds fly north in summer.
Chicago is four hours north of Indianapolis.
north.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: the northeastern states of the US, especially during the Civil War (1861–65) when they fought against the South
north.translation[3].definitions[1].defi: the northern part of England, which includes the area north of the Midlands and south of the Scottish border, and contains several large cities, including Manchester, Leeds, Liverpool, and Newcastle
north.translation[3].definitions[2].defi: the richer countries of the northern parts of the world, especially Europe and North America
north.translation[4].definitions[0].defi: if an amount is north of another amount, it is more than that amount
north.translation[4].definitions[0].exam: To be a big player, a company must spend somewhere north of $500 million a year.
